intro: Iria pycnocephala, commonly known as the dense-headed iria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, spherical inflorescence, which consists of numerous small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often covered with a fine layer of pubescence. Iria pycnocephala is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
